title: Gina Rinehart swaps Derby Day for Paspaley Pearl centenary
text:
The retirement of Winx may have robbed this year’s Cox Plate of the undisputed queen of the race track, but fortunately our undisputed queen of the Rich List was on hand to bring some extra glamour.

Gina Rinehart swept into the Moonee Valley committee room with two companions on Saturday afternoon and took in several races from the room’s grandstand seating, perfectly positioned above the finish line.

Asked for a tip by our correspondent, Rinehart demurred, saying she hadn’t kept a close enough eye on the form to offer an opinion. Hopefully she stuck with the favorite, Japanese mare Lys Gracieux, who stormed to a stunning win.

Gina Rinehart last Derby Day. Luis Enrique Ascui

But she did reveal she will miss the annual highlight of the Spring Carnival for Australia’s corporate sector and racing aficionados, Derby Day at Flemington.

She has other plans. After heading to NSW to do some filming on one of her waygu cattle properties next week, Rinehart — who is rarely seen without a string of pearls around her neck — will join Nick Paspaley to celebrate the centenary of his family’s iconic pearl empire at a lavish party.

“It’s a wonderful Australian business,” Rinehart said, showing off a pair of spectacular Paspaley earrings.
